",["$r","p",null,{"children":["Many React-based frameworks are full-stack and let your React app take advantage of the server. However, you can use the same approach even if you can’t or don’t want to run JavaScript on the server. In that case, serve the HTML/CSS/JS export (",["$r","a",null,{"href":"https://nextjs.org/docs/advanced-features/static-html-export","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow noopener noreferrer","children":[["$r","code",null,{"children":"next export"}]," output"]}]," for Next.js, default for Gatsby) at ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"/some-app/"}]," instead."]}]," ",["$r","h2",null,{"id":"using-react-for-a-part-of-your-existing-page","children":"Using React for a part of your existing page "}]," ",["$r","p",null,{"children":"Let’s say you have an existing page built with another technology (either a server one like Rails, or a client one like Backbone), and you want to render interactive React components somewhere on that page. That’s a common way to integrate React—in fact, it’s how most React usage looked at Meta for many years!"}]," ",["$r","p",null,{"children":"You can do this in two steps:"}]," ",["$r","ol",null,{"children":[" ",["$r","li",null,{"children":[["$r","strong",null,{"children":"Set up a JavaScript environment"}]," that lets you use the ",["$r","a",null,{"href":"/learn/writing-markup-with-jsx","children":"JSX syntax"}],", split your code into modules with the ",["$r","a",null,{"href":"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/import","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow noopener noreferrer","children":["$r","code",null,{"children":"import"}]}]," / ",["$r","a",null,{"href":"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/export","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow noopener noreferrer","children":["$r","code",null,{"children":"export"}]}]," syntax, and use packages (for example, React) from the ",["$r","a",null,{"href":"https://www.npmjs.com/","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow noopener noreferrer","children":"npm"}]," package registry."]}]," ",["$r","li",null,{"children":[["$r","strong",null,{"children":"Render your React components"}]," where you want to see them on the page."]}]," "]}]," ",["$r","p",null,{"children":"The exact approach depends on your existing page setup, so let’s walk through some details."}]," ",["$r","h3",null,{"id":"step-1-set-up-a-modular-javascript-environment","children":"Step 1: Set up a modular JavaScript environment "}]," ",["$r","p",null,{"children":["A modular JavaScript environment lets you write your React components in individual files, as opposed to writing all of your code in a single file. It also lets you use all the wonderful packages published by other developers on the ",["$r","a",null,{"href":"https://www.npmjs.com/","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow noopener noreferrer","children":"npm"}]," registry—including React itself! How you do this depends on your existing setup:"]}]," ",["$r","ul",null,{"children":[" ",["$r","li",null,{"children":[" ",["$r","p",null,{"children":[["$r","strong",null,{"children":["If your app is already split into files that use ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"import"}]," statements,"]}]," try to use the setup you already have. If it causes a syntax error, you might need to ",["$r","a",null,{"href":"https://babeljs.io/setup","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow noopener noreferrer","children":"transform your JavaScript code with Babel"}],", and enable the ",["$r","a",null,{"href":"https://babeljs.io/docs/babel-preset-react","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow noopener noreferrer","children":"Babel React preset"}]," to use JSX."]}]," "]}]," ",["$r","li",null,{"children":[" ",["$r","p",null,{"children":[["$r","strong",null,{"children":"If your app doesn’t have an existing setup for compiling JavaScript modules,"}]," set it up with ",["$r","a",null,{"href":"https://vitejs.dev/","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow noopener noreferrer","children":"Vite"}],". If your backend framework is not listed, ",["$r","a",null,{"href":"https://vitejs.dev/guide/backend-integration.html","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow noopener noreferrer","children":"follow this guide"}]," to manually integrate Vite builds with your backend."]}]," "]}]," "]}]," ",["$r","p",null,{"children":"To check whether your setup works, run this command in your project folder:"}]," ",["$r","TerminalBlock",null,{"children":["$r","p",null,{"children":"npm install react react-dom"}]}]," ",["$r","p",null,{"children":["Then add these lines of code at the top of your main JavaScript file (it might be called ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"index.js"}]," or ",["$r","code",null,{"children":"main.js"}],"):"]}]," "]}],["$r","Sandpack",null,{"children":[["$r","pre",null,{"children":["$r","code",null,{"className":"language-html","meta":"index.html hidden","children":" My app "}]}],["$r","pre",null,{"children":["$r","code",null,{"className":"language-js","meta":"src/index.js active","children":"import { createRoot } from 'react-dom/client'; // Clear the existing HTML content document.body.innerHTML = '

If you ever reach that point, we recommend migrating to ",["$r","a",null,{"href":"/learn/start-a-new-react-project","children":"a React framework"}]," right after to get the most out of React."]}]," ",["$r","h2",null,{"id":"using-react-native-in-an-existing-native-mobile-app","children":"Using React Native in an existing native mobile app "}]," ",["$r","p",null,{"children":[["$r","a",null,{"href":"https://reactnative.dev/","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow noopener noreferrer","children":"React Native"}]," can also be integrated into existing native apps incrementally. If you have an existing native app for Android (Java or Kotlin) or iOS (Objective-C or Swift), ",["$r","a",null,{"href":"https://reactnative.dev/docs/integration-with-existing-apps","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow noopener noreferrer","children":"follow this guide"}]," to add a React Native screen to it."]}]]}]]

meta.title: Add React to an Existing Project
